intro_text: As app1 follows p_l on a training patrol to learn the territory, there's a muffled thump behind {PRONOUN/p_l/self} . {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/whirl/whirls} around, finding a beady black eye and huge beak far far too close to {PRONOUN/p_l/self} .
decline_text: Thinking better of it, the cats try to hunt instead.
success_text: app1 leaps backwards, falling in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} haste and scrambling upright. Then in one of the weirdest moments of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} young life, the green bird does the same thing, chattering as it leans sideways to tumble a little way down the slope. It's not broken, p_l grumbles, coming up to stand by app1. Kea are just, well, like that.

p_l hisses for app1 to back away. Slowly. That's a kea, and while it's been a long time since the Clan lost anyone to one... app1 suddenly notices the claws the size of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head. The kea chirps weirdly, tilting its head sideways, but when the cats don't move it seems to scoff at {PRONOUN/p_l/self} , spreading its wings with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} shocking orange undersides and flapping back into the air.

app1 freezes in fear, but s_c comes up next to {PRONOUN/p_l/self} , and bats a stone down the slope. The bird shrieks, startlingly loud, and waves its wings around. s_c offers it a branch from a shrub, dangling it like playing with a kit in the nursery, and the kea merrily hops after it, as p_l leads it teasingly away from app1. Later, app1 apologizes for being scared, and is shocked when s_c tells {PRONOUN/p_l/object} that no, kea are very dangerous.
